workExperience.title: Software Engineer I
responsibilities: Helped to build and improve a highly-scalable event ingestion solution using AWS EventBridge, SQS, and ECS to process, store, and search over 1 billion events
Created endpoints used for end-to-end reversion of medical claim events using AWS API Gateway and Lambda to support a company-wide push to improve data integrity
Collaborated with a team of 3 to develop a React-based frontend for configuring customer data, reducing mistakes and speeding up onboarding of customers by 50%

workExperience.title: Computer Science Teacher
responsibilities: Taught in the Information Technology pathway of the Career and Technical Education program, helping prepare students for careers in web development and game development
Designed curriculum and taught classes covering JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Scratch, critical thinking, and problem solving
Collaborated extensively with students, parents, teachers, and administrators to maximize outcomes and meet student needs

workExperience.title: Computer Science Teacher
responsibilities: Taught Advanced Placement Computer Science and Intro to Java
Faculty mentor to a FIRST Robotics team

workExperience.title: Mathematics Teacher
responsibilities: Taught High School Algebra and Geometry
Students were four times more likely to pass the Algebra Regents state exam than the school average

projects.name: Chicagoland Melee Stats
projects.description: Full stack app created for the Chicago Super Smash Bros. Melee community to track tournament statistics and compare and rank players. Used daily by a community of over 500 players.
bullets: Used GCP Cloud Scheduler to automate querying the start.gg GraphQL API and access tournament data for the Chicagoland area daily
Created a backend using Java Spring and PostgreSQL which compiles and aggregates tournament data and ranks players with the Glicko2 rating system
Created a REST API and deployed to GCP using Docker to allow for realtime querying of data
Worked with a UI/UX designer to build a fully-responsive frontend using React and hosted with WordPress

projects.name: Chicagoland Melee Power Rankings Graphics
projects.description: Interactive, animated website released quarterly to present the community-voted rankings for the Chicago Melee community
bullets: Built a fully responsive React frontend featuring animations and custom scrolling behavior

projects.name: Chicagoland Melee Stream Overlay (In Progress)
projects.description: Overlay used by twitch.tv/chicagomelee to display stats about players during tournament streams.
bullets: Used React, Typescript, and Electron to create a stream overlay which displays up-to-date competitor data from the start.gg API and CLM stats
Integrates with Tournament Stream Helper and Open Broadcaster Software to automatically update the overlay when players change

projects.name: Portfolio Website
projects.description: Personal website containing my resume and portfolio.
bullets: Fully responsive website built using React, TypeScript, and TailwindCSS
Optimized SEO using Lighthouse to achieve a score of 100

projects.name: New York Times Crossword App
projects.description: Desktop app used to solve the New York Time Crossword puzzles and store and track statistics on solve times.
bullets: Pulled daily crossword puzzle files from the New York Times website using Mozilla Cookie Jar
Built a custom parser to recreate a puzzle grid from proprietary .puz files and validate solutions
Used a MySQL database to store and track statistics and visualized them using graphs built with MatPlotLib and Seaborn

projects.name: Dungeon Buddies
projects.description: Top down strategy game built in one week for the Brackeys Game Jam 2021.1
bullets: Used Unity, C#, and Aseprite to design and program a game from scratch
Collaborated with another developer using Agile Methodology to assign and track work
